paragraphs: On Monday, September 8, in the village of Staré Hamry (Moravian-Silesian Region), a private bus carrying Czech schoolchildren around the age of 15 overturned while taking them on a trip to the Beskids Mountains. As a result of the accident, everyone in the bus sustained injuries of varying severity.
The police, firefighters, and paramedics arrived at the scene promptly. They provided assistance to 2 adults and 32 schoolchildren.

Three people sustained serious injuries, two of them of moderate severity, while the others escaped with minor bruises and abrasions on their legs and heads. All the patients were taken to hospitals in neighboring cities. There is no threat to their lives.

"Before the arrival of emergency services, the first aid to the victims was provided by a witness who established that all passengers were outside the bus and conscious. Following instructions from the dispatcher, the man examined several injured individuals and ensured their relocation to a safe place," said Lukash Gumpel, a representative of the regional emergency medical service.
The accident occurred around 10:00 on the road leading to the cottages and cable car.
"The driver, while driving to the ski resort, veered off the road and crashed into a pole of the power line, causing the bus to overturn," said police representative Katerina Kubzova.
One of the possible reasons for the road accident is a technical malfunction. The bus will be seized for further expert examination.
